title: Ticket #3201: Garbage characters from CondorError / SecMan
description:
When a TCP connection fails, we get the following message: 

08/16/12 14:05:40 ERROR: SECMAN:Ô:Failed to create security session to <129.93.239.155:9618> with TCP.
|SECMAN:Ó:TCP connection to <129.93.239.155:9618> failed.

Note that it improperly breaks over 2 lines and it prints a garbage character for the error code. The garbage character is from this line: 

errbuf += walk->_code

Probably, the intent is to append the error code to the errbuf. However, this converts walk->_code to char, and appends a char instead.
remarks:
2012-Aug-20 08:57:35 by nwp:
This error resulted from not carefully looking at the differences between std::string and MyString. See differences between std::string and MyString

2012-Aug-20 09:05:47 by nwp:
It is not clear where Brian branched from, as the version of src/condor_utils/CondorError.cpp in master has the MyString implementation. Indeed, there are no commits in the repository that correspond to the source blobs in the patch.

2012-Aug-20 09:17:42 by bbockelm:
Hi,

This is what I see on master: 

commit 0890132c9bb565c577108ec0fea03a7fb8210a47
Author: Matthew Farrellee <matt@redhat.com>
Date:   Tue Jun 5 08:05:21 2012 -0400

    Removed MyString use in CondorError

What branch are you using?

Brian

2012-Aug-20 09:27:48 by nwp:
Quite right. I malformed my search query. master indeed does have the relevant blobs. (I neglected to add "-r" to git ls-tree).

2012-Aug-20 10:40:55 by nwp:
CODE REVIEW Patch looks fine. Pushed into master at ea91b03.
